text: the graphene is just a material it's a
it's a wonder mature if you like in the
sense of it's got super properties but
really it's the applications that sell
it how can we use this material to
change the world we live in to actually
have an impact on the economy here in
the UK so here you see the first
application which is the light bulb but
there's other applications coming
through a membrane for example where we
can purify water we're looking at
coatings where we can have protective
coatings on steel or masonry we're
looking at how we can use graphene in
batteries for energy storage and we can
actually use graphene for a drug
delivery because what we find with some
of these graphene flakes when we put it
into a solution is that it's attracted
to cancer cells now of course this is
very early research but actually if we
can use that to deliver the drug to
these cancer cells that would have a
significant impact
so once the material has been has been
discovered the key now is how can we use
this to have an impact on the world we
live in
